reviewText: An interesting look into 1979 gay Brazil scene.
If the movie was not trimed probley look better.
Should have focused more on Finha. Could have had a lot less of the club scenes.

Best Brazilian film of 2014 - a beautiful touching love story at the background of historic burlesque vaudeville's theater challenge to the then military dictatorship in the late 1970s. The acting is superb, and the backdrop of the gay sensibilities of the time is engrossing.  It is a pleasure to see a again a strong romantic hero performance from Jesuita Barbosa, fresh from his superb acting in the role of a younger brother in "Futuro Beach". He received a well-deserved Brazilian Oscar for his portraying of an army police recruit not well suited to fight the enemy.

Set in the late 1970s 'Tatuagem' is a story of Clcio (Irandhir Santos Elite Squad) who runs what is described as an anarchist theatre club where they challenge the authority of the military dictatorship by putting on avant garde shows  basically lots of nudity and having fun. Star Paulette is sleeping with Clcio until his brother in law turns up. This is 18 year old soldier Fininho  the two hit it off immediately.

Meanwhile back at the barracks all is not as it seems with Fininho being bullied for not liking the ladies. There are also the side stories of the families and the ordinary ups and downs that add to highlight how much fun the theatre is  this is called The Star Spangled Floor and they describe it as the Studio 54 of the Favella! They also have a very inventive bent for making costumes  scanty  and props  check out the helmet made from a colander.

This is a very vibrant film with some good period detail and a lovely soundtrack with some notable performances too. It is not a mammoth sex fest but it does have some well realised bedroom scenes. It is also a film that will put a smile on your face and considering some of the subject matter here that is quite an achievement. This is one I rented but now intend to buy as its one I know I will get more out of on subsequent viewings.

Well,I can speak french and a little spanish,but sadly no portuguese ,and since there were no sub-titles I'm not quite sure of the plot.
I would appreciate a refund.
I struggled through this and finally gave up 15 minutes before it ended. Really bad. Made no sense.

One of the worst film's in my collection. The acting and dialogue were so fake and pathetic. It was like a traveling sideshow except I wouldn't spend a dime watching such a stupid performance. I could not believe there was such a show.
sub titles not working and no way to get refund or get anyone one to help -
Much better than I expected it to be.  I would recommend the movie simply for the eye candy alone.
